My Motivation To Code

To me, learning to code is about unlocking a new form of literacy in the modern world. It represents the perfect intersection of logical problem-solving and creative expression. I am driven by the desire to move from being a passive consumer of technology to an active creator, capable of building tools that can help others and solve real-world issues.

Beyond the intellectual challenge, I am motivated by the agency and stability a career in tech provides. Coding is a skill that rewards persistence and curiosity, offering a meritocratic path to professional growth regardless of where you start. I want to join an industry that is constantly evolving, ensuring I never stop learning.

Ultimately, learning to code is not just about mastering syntax; it is about gaining the power to shape my own future and contribute meaningfully to the digital landscape. I am ready to embrace the challenges of the learning curve for the reward of a lifelong skill.

What I Have Covered So Far

  1. Intro To Digital Slack
  2. Using Slack and search engines
  3. How to use AI appropriately
  4. Working with Google Sheets
  5. Building a personal webpage on CodePen with HTML and CSS
